medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms related to elevated lipase were noted during her visit to the ED, where she mentioned feeling well and asymptomatic at this time. No specific onset time or progression was provided for the lipase elevation but it was a concern raised by her nephrologist.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type I diabetes complicated by retinopathy and ESRD requiring hemodialysis, s/p simultaneous pancreas and kidney transplant. Remote history of tuberculosis treated with oral medications for six months. Additional history includes hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and osteoporosis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with type 2 diabetes, father with type 2 diabetes, and a healthy brother.
medical_history.social_history: No alcohol use; the patient occasionally misses her morning medications. No other relevant social history was provided.
